div.p:
Antonio:
Thanks for your help. Counting standard drinks is a consistent way to measure how much you’ve had. It makes a lot more sense than counting the number of glasses.

Chrisdine:
Definitely. If you just measure by container you really won’t get a sense of how much alcohol you are consuming. It depends on what you’re drinking and who’s pouring.

Antonio:
That makes sense. This is all great information—now when we talk about how many drinks is “low risk,” we’ll know what one drink really is.
